description:
Key Responsibilities

Reporting to the Legal Counsel (Disciplinary Proceedings), the incumbent is responsible for the following:

Scrutinize and prepare disciplinary cases for submission to the Disciplinary Committee of the Authority
Provide analysis on evidence to facilitate disposal of disciplinary cases
Present cases at disciplinary inquiry hearings conducted by the Disciplinary Committee
Supervise and coach staff members to carry out the disciplinary proceedings function
Assist the Section Head in the management of the Disciplinary Proceedings Section
Perform such other duties as may from time to time be assigned
Requirements
A recognized university degree in Law
At least 3 years’ relevant experience in prosecution or litigation preferably 2 years of which at supervisory level; or a qualified solicitor / barrister with at least 1 year’s post-qualification experience in litigation practice
Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese (Preferably attained Grade “C” or above in English Language (Syllabus B) and Chinese Language in HKCEE, or Level 4 or above in HKDSEE, or equivalent)
Qualified legal practitioner, legal executive in litigation, or court/tribunal prosecutor preferred
Good written and verbal presentation skill
Terms of Appointment
Competitive remuneration package commensurate with the selected candidate’s qualifications and experience will be offered. The appointee will initially be offered a 3-year contract, subject to renewal upon satisfactory performance and the service needs of the Authority.
Application Procedure                                       
Applications with full resume indicating your current and expected salaries and your public examination results should be sent to: Human Resources Section, Estate Agents Authority, 7/F, E-Trade Plaza, 24 Lee Chung Street, Chaiwan, Hong Kong or email via "Apply now" at  not later than 31 January 2022. Candidates who have already responded to our previous advertisement of the same post in November 2021 need not re-apply. Please mark “Private and Confidential” on the envelope and quote the post applied for and its reference number on the envelope.
Candidates who are not invited to attend an interview within 6 weeks from the closing date may assume their applications unsuccessful. Applications may be considered for other suitable positions within the Authority. All applications will be treated in strict confidence. Personal data provided in the applications will only be used for recruitment-related purposes. All information on non-shortlisted applicants will be destroyed after 6 months.


WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES EMPLOYER

Skills: Good Cantonese, Fair English and Putonghua; Able to read and write Chinese and English, typing work is required

Location: Hong Kong Central Library

Working hours: Monday to Sunday - 9:30 am to 9:15 pm, 7.8 hours a day, 5 days per week, shift work

Salary: $11,500 - $12,500 per month (including bonus) 
               

(Welcome to the "Medium and Senior Employment Scheme" participants, housewives and new arrivals applications)

If you are interested, please email your resume to us. The personal data collected will be kept confidential and used only for recruitment purposes

薪酬：$11,500 - $12,500/月 (包勤工)

description:
Duties:


To assist Seniors in Cargo Ships Safety (CSS) Section in administering the Integrated Fleet Information System (iFIS) and Combined System Development for the Enhancement of iFIS and Ships and Seafarers Registration System (SSRS) for the Marine Department (MD)

To assist seniors in handling administrative work for the issuance and filing of Minimum Safe Manning Certificates (MSMC), Declaration of Maritime Labour Compliance Part I (DMLC Part I) and Wreck Removal Certificates (WRC);

To assist seniors in handling administrative work for issuing and filing exemptions / dispensations for Hong Kong-registered cargo ships and prepare the monthly and quarterly reports on exemption/dispensation issued;
To assist seniors in extracting information and documents such as certificates, survey reports and audit reports issued by Recognized Organizations (ROs) for scrutinising and verifying by assigned surveyors; and then assist to prepare the reports on performance of ROs, including preparation of relevant statistics, which will be published in the MD’s website;
To assist seniors in screening Port State Control (PSC) Checklist for all HK Ships before entering USA or Australia ports;
To be the Electronic Recordkeeping System (ERKS) coordinator in the CSS Section; and
To carry out any other duties as assigned by seniors.

.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree, preferably in law / computer science related studies, from a Hong Kong university, or equivalent; and
Met the language proficiency requirements of Level 2 or above in Chinese Language and English Language in HKDSEE or HKCEE, or equivalent. Priority will be given to candidates with good command in both Chinese Language and English Language; and
Chinese word-processing speed of 20 words per minute and English word-processing speed of 30 words per minute and knowledge in the application of common business software, especially Microsoft Excel; and
Prior administrative working experience in Government Bureaux / Departments will be an advantage.

Applications are invited for appointment as Post-doctoral Fellow (PDF)/Assistant Research Officer (ARO) in the School of Public Health (Ref.: 509156), to commence as soon as possible for one year, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance.

Applicants should possess a doctoral degree by research or equivalent in public health, social sciences, or related disciplines, with at least one year's experience in community-based research, public health research or population sciences research. They should have knowledge of community health promotion, and/or experience in the application of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) in research. They should also have the ability to work independently as well as in a multidisciplinary team; the ability to collaborate with external parties including academics, social service groups and politicians; and excellent written and verbal communication skills.

The appointee will work for the Jockey Club SMART Family-Link Project, with the aim to promote family well-being by leveraging ICT for innovative family services.  He/She will coordinate research design; liaise with community parties and institutions; plan, develop and conduct community-based interventions and training programmes for local social service practitioners and professionals; facilitate the collection of big data; oversee data collection and management; write scientific publications and reports; supervise research staff members; and perform other duties as assigned. Those who have responded to the previous advertisement (Ref.: 498698) need not re-apply.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits. 

The University only accepts online application for the above post. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V.  Review of applications will start on December 21, 2021 and continue until February 28, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.

Advertised:Dec 7, 2021 (HK Time)
Applications close:Feb 28, 2022 (HK Time)

Job Duties:

Assist in the overall planning, implementation and evaluation of the project
Liaise , establish and reinforce working partnerships with stakeholder include Dh services, non –government organist ion, tertiary institution and others to ensure effective and efficient cooperation in developing, implementing and timely delivery of quality works for the project
Transcribe teaching materials of basic life skills training programme in the Std HS of the DH into education materials for wider general public groups and to plan and implement dissemination of these materials for wider through relevant channels including websites and other social media
Plan, organize, monitor process and co-ordinate various of the Project, including production of creative visual-art effects and audio –visual programmes , printing education materials etc. for the project
Develop a new website and web content that are appealing to adolescents by transcribing, packaging and re-designing teaching and health education material of Basic Life Skills Training and Topical Programmes in the Std HS of the DH into multi-media formats, including production of infographic, motion graphics, e-magazines and video , to promulgate the key messages in the Campaign
Arrange meeting with various stakeholders and provide secretariat support during the process
 Assist in planning , organizing and conducting related surveys, studies and evaluation
Provide general administrative and logistic support, e.g procurement, contract management etc.
Perform ad hoc task

Job Requriements:

Having a Bachelor degree with honours in the field of psychology and preferable to have a master or above degree in a theoretical or an applied field of psychology
Having at least 5 years of post-qualification experience, preferably in project and contract management
Having 3 years of post-qualification experience relating to implementation of health education programme at schools or school students service setting
Having recent 3 year of networking with NGOs working closely with local secondary school
Fluent in spoken and written English: Grade C or above in Use of English of the HKAL or English of the GCE A Level) or overall band 6.5 or above in the same setting in the Academic Module of IELTS within the 2 years or CRE Use of English in Level 2
Fluent in spoken and written Chinese : Grade C or above in Chinese Language and Culture or Chinese language and Literature of the HKALE or CRE Use of Chinese in Level 2
Good Team player processing good communication and interpersonal skills
Having proficient computer Skill(MS Office)

Play Officer (Centre Operation)
Playright Children's Play Association
Tai Po, Tai Wo

Job Description/ Responsibilities


To assist supervisor in delivering, support and promoting children's play by creating high-quality child-centered indoor free play opportunities for all children.
To contribute to the maintenance and improvement of the center operating system.
To assist the supervisor to oversee the daily center operation.
To supervise the supporting staff for sure the quality center service delivery.

Requirements


Degree holder in any discipline.
At least one-year working experiences
Be able to build good relationships with key stakeholders, such as parents, contractors and community organizations
Be a good team player, independent, self-motivated, positive thinking, possess good interpersonal skills, and able to handle challenges
Mature, energetic, creative, and highly motivated
Have a passion for working with children through play
Work on weekends/public holidays are occasionally required

 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* Internal Play Training will be arranged* 

*Play Worker Qualification is required (The Association will offer the Play Worker training if the candidate do not have such qualification)*

保良局創立於1878年,我們本著以人為本的信念,秉承 「保赤安良、扶康育長」 的宗旨,聯繫及善用社會資源,為市民提供多元化的優質社會服務,包括家庭服務、幼兒服務、兒童及青少年服務、康復服務、安老服務、醫療及綜合健康服務,每年服務人數超過100,000人。

Po Leung Kuk is established since 1878, adhering to the “people-oriented” philosophy and the mission of “protecting the young and the innocent, aiding the needy and nurturing the talents”, Connect with and make good use of social resources to provide citizens with diversified high-quality social services, including integrated family services, child care services, children and youth services, rehabilitation services, elderly services, medical and comprehensive health services, with more than 100,000 people served each year.

安老服務

入職要求

學位註冊社工/護士/治療師,七年督導安老/康復服務經驗,獲聘者會獲分配管理安老及/或康復服務的單位, 並因應服務及發展需要進行職位輪調。

主要職責

負責安老/康復服務單位的督導及發展, 監控屬下服務單位財務預算及運作,統籌跨單位服務及活動計劃等工作。

銅鑼灣 [email redacted, apply via Company website] 2277 8151

In response to the implementation of the "Sexual Conviction Record Check" mechanism, some prospective employee is required to conduct a sexual conviction record check before entering employment. Applicants who are not contacted within 6 weeks may consider their application unsuccessful and all unsuccessful applications will be destroyed upon completion with six month of the recruitment exercise. For more information about Po Leung Kuk, please visit: http://www.poleungkuk.org.hk.

Key Responsibilities

The incumbent will be posted to the Legal Services & Examination Section to handle the following:

assist in the setting and developing of questions for qualifying examinations
co-ordinate the administration of qualifying examinations with the appointed service provider
assist with the preparation of examination-related documentation, reports and statistics
follow up with incidents that involve examination irregularities and breaches of examination regulations
handle enquiries on qualifying examinations and related matters
perform such other duties as may from time to time be assigned
Requirements
A recognized university degree, preferably in law
At least 2 years’ relevant working experience in law firms and preferably in property related practice
Legal executive without a recognized university degree but with at least 6 years of solid experience in property related practice will be considered
Previous examination officer experience is an added advantage
Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese (Preferably attained Grade “C” or above in English Language (Syllabus B) and Chinese Language in HKCEE, or Level 4 or above in HKDSEE, or equivalent)
Good communication skills
Meticulous and a strong team player
Terms of Appointment
Competitive remuneration package commensurate with the selected candidate’s qualifications and experience will be offered. The appointee will initially be offered a 3-year contract, subject to renewal upon satisfactory performance and the service needs of the Authority.
Application Procedure
Applications with full resume indicating your current and expected salaries and your public examination results should be sent to: Human Resources Section, Estate Agents Authority, 7/F, E-Trade Plaza, 24 Lee Chung Street, Chaiwan, Hong Kong or via email by clicking "Apply Now" not later than 31 December 2021. Candidates who have already responded to our previous advertisement of the same post in November 2021 need not re-apply. Please mark “Private and Confidential” on the envelope and quote the post applied for and its reference number on the envelope.
Candidates who are not invited to attend an interview within 6 weeks from the closing date may assume their applications unsuccessful. Applications may be considered for other suitable positions within the Authority. All applications will be treated in strict confidence. Personal data provided in the applications will only be used for recruitment-related purposes. All information on non-shortlisted applicants will be destroyed after 6 months.

job_title: Legal Counsel (VP/ SVP etc. dependent on experience)
description:
Title: Legal Counsel (VP/ SVP etc. dependent on experience)

Location: Hong Kong, Central

Client Background:

Our client is one of the leading APAC funds houses with an enviable track record in mainland China, HK and international investments.
With an AUM in excess of XXX USD Billions, this is an instantly recognizable brand and name.

 
Job Description/ Requirements:

This is a role within the Legal Department.

1. Bachelor’s degree or above, with major in law and related fields;

2. Those who are qualified to practice law in Hong Kong or China; with ideally 3 years PQE.

3. Familiar with the rules of HK listed companies, the SFC rules on direct investment and the rules and regulations of the China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC);

4. Good written and typing skills in simplified/ traditional Chinese and English;

5. Complete other projects or tasks assigned by the senior management of the company.

6. Responsible for revising and improving the company's legal management system and policies.

7. Complete other projects and tasks assigned by senior management as may be required by the company.


Requirements, Skills and Experiencee:

1. Must have a bachelor’s degree or above in law.
2. Have 2 to 3 years PQE or similar qualifications is highly preferred but not essential. Must be able to practice law in HK or Mainland China.
3. Can read, write, and speak Mandarin and English with strong Chinese typing skills.
4. IANG, HK Permanent or dependents residence is required as no work visa will be sponsored


Remuneration/ Benefits:

The group is well known for offering exceptional fringe benefits which are commensurate of the top funds houses, financial services firms, and banking institutions, with benefits that includes free lunches, drinks, fruits and snacks, medical insurance, and allowances and discretionary personal and performance related bonuses.

Harbridge Partners Limited
Employment Agency Licence:  65522
selling_points: 2 to 3 years PQE Lawyer,qualified in HK or China
Top fund house for direct investment projects
PE or buy side funds investment,law firm,contracts

To support P&C Claims Team to enhance and grow existing Fraud detection and prevention capabilities
To share and embed best practices, refine anti-fraud policies and methodologies and work with AXA Stakeholders, relevant external bodies and competitors to develop a more mature Anti-Fraud strategy
Provides technical direction to external investigators on complex and SIU investigations

Develop key metrics, governance, process, vendor management and training programs to educate and inform the Claims Team to continue professionalizing their fraud detection and prevention capabilities in-house
Perform ad hoc projects or any other duties as assigned from time to time
Thorough knowledge of claims management processes and procedures
Multi-line experience preferred. Experience in handling complex claims and suspected insurance fraud investigations
Strong investigative background with experience in handling investigations into bodily Injury related claims
Understanding of local Insurance Laws

description:
Play Officer (Playscope) 

Responsibilities 



To assist in deliver, support and promote children's play by creating high quality child-centred indoor free play opportunity for all children.  
To contribute to the creation, maintenance and improvement of the child- friendly and safe play environments.
To assist in the service planning work, including play setting, programmes design and promotion plan
To undertake related courses to enhance or increase personal knowledge and understanding of play and playwork practice.
To be responsible for the daily operations of the play services
Assist in ad hoc play projects as assigned   

 Requirements 



Degree holder in any discipline.  
At least two-year working experiences
Playwork Qualification is required(The Association will offer the Playwork training if the candidate do not have such qualification)
Be able to build good relationships with children and their parents and carers.
Be a good team player, independent, self-motivated, positive thinking, possess good interpersonal skills and able to handle challenges
Mature, energetic, creative and highly motivated
Have a passion for working with children through play
Work on weekends/public holidays are occasionally required

 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
* Prospective employee is requested to undergo Sexual Conviction Record Check on voluntary basis * 

* Internal Play Training will be arranged* 

*Play Worker Qualification is required (The Association will offer the Play Worker training if the candidate do not have such qualification)*

All personal data will be used for recruitment purpose only.  Unsuccessful applications will be destroyed upon completion of the recruitment exercise.
